creditline: Gift of funds from Kathleen Bendel
description: black, red and chrome; crank handle lifts domed top section to reveal perforated cone and cup
inscription: \"Juice-King\", stamped on top, front of dome; model number and patent numbers stamped on bottom
medium: Enameled steel, chrome, pigment, electrical components
text: In the 1950s, many kitchen machines rapidly cast off anonymous functionality in favor of personality styling.  A variety of orange and lemon squeezers flooded the market.  Many, such as the "Juice-King," appeared to be miniature robots.
title: "Juice-King" orange juicer, model J.K.-25
